p: The compound identified in the most active fraction of the M6LFr extract of A. ochroleuca was Benzene, 1,3-bis (3-phenoxyphenoxy)-. The major compound in essential oil of Bridelia micrantha, Benzene, 1,3-bis (3-phenoxyphenoxy)- has shown antimicrobial activity against Mycobacterium tuberculosis [ 36]. However, there are no reports of this compound having antifungal activity against P. clavispora and C. gloeosporioides.
